description: From Sanskrit साधु (sādhú, “good; good man, holy man”).

entries.meaning: (Hinduism) An ascetic or practitioner of yoga (yogi) who has given up pursuit of the first three Hindu goals of life: kama (enjoyment), artha (practical objectives) and even dharma (duty).
examples: It was clad in white in the manner of an Indian sadu or holy man, and it was walking barefoot on the grubby pavements.
